summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The City of Dallas is convening a special called meeting on March 25, 2025, at 11:30 A.M. at the Oak Cliff Municipal Center. The purpose of this meeting is to review and make recommendations regarding amendments to specific chapters of the Dallas City Code related to building regulations.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Call to Order.  
2. Approval of minutes from the March 5, 2024, special called meeting.  
3. Review and recommendations on amendments to Chapter 52 (Administrative Procedures), Chapter 53 (International Building Code), and Chapter 57 (International Residential Code), including a name change for Chapter 57 to reflect a broader scope (Dallas One- to Eight-Family Dwelling Code).  
4. Adjournment.

**Important Details**:  
The proposed amendments aim to update administrative procedures and building codes to enhance compliance and safety standards. The name change for Chapter 57 signifies an expansion in the types of residential buildings covered under the code, which may impact regulatory practices and construction standards in the city.

**Action Items**:  
The meeting seeks approval of the minutes from the previous meeting and recommendations for the proposed amendments to the city code. Attendees wishing to speak must register in advance, and the meeting will be accessible via video conference for broader community participation.
